title: Preeminent Energy Industry Executive George Dials Named President Of Pajarito Scientific Corporation
text:
Pajarito Scientific Corporation 
SANTA FE, N.M., Sept. 3, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- On May 4, 2015, George Dials was named as President of Pajarito Scientific Corporation, Inc., ("PSC") located in Santa Fe, New Mexico. He will also serve on the Board of Directors of PSC and affiliated companies. Mr. Dials will direct all operations at PSC and serve as primary executive interface with stakeholders. "I'm please and excited that George has joined the PSC team," said David Heath, Chairman of the Board of PSC. "His extensive experience, leadership and knowledge in the industry will benefit the company worldwide." 
https://photos.prnewswire.com/prnvar/20150902/263264LOGO 
George Dials is a proven leader, with extensive knowledge and over 30 years experience in energy, national security, waste management and nuclear technology programs. He has held leadership positions in the US Army, major corporations and at the Department of Energy. During his military service, which included a tour as an Infantry Company Commander in Vietnam, he was awarded a Silver Star, 4 Bronze Stars, 2 Air Medals and numerous other awards and decorations. He also served a tour as a Nuclear Weapons specialist at the Los Alamos National Laboratory. 
Mr. Dials hails from West Virginia but currently resides in Santa Fe, New Mexico. He attended the United States Military Academy, West Point, earning a BS degree in engineering. He also holds MS degrees in Nuclear Engineering and Political Science from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). As a member of the Senior Executive Service in the U.S. Department of Energy, Mr. Dials was the manager of the Carlsbad Area Office and also served as assistant manager of the Department of Energy, Idaho Operations office. His corporate assignments included: President and COO of Waste Control Specialists, LLC; President and General Manager of TRW Environmental Safety Systems (Yucca Mountain Project) and President and CEO of B&W Y-12, LLC. Mr. Dials stated, "I look forward to the opportunity to work with the PSC team. PSC has an excellent reputation for its quality service, unparalleled expertise in the industry and reliable products." 
PSC is a privately-owned small business located in Santa Fe, New Mexico. PSC is a world leader in supporting international and domestic safeguards, commercial and government nuclear remediation, re-processing, criticality safety and energy generation. The Company has 30 years of operating experience, including a comprehensive range of proven standard and customized instruments, plant-integrated systems and contract measurement services which provides safe, cost-effective solutions to every kind of nuclear materials assay and characterization need. PSC currently has operations in Los Alamos, NM | Hanford, WA | Savannah River, SC | Oakridge, TN and has installed systems in Japan and China. 
Mr. Dials will also serve on the Board of Directors for Radiation Protection Systems, Inc ("RPS"), a Connecticut based company whose majority shareholder is PSC. RPS provides radiation shielding, HEPA ventilation, containment for hazardous environments as well as engineering services and technical support services to the nuclear and pharmaceutical industries. "We are pleased and excited to have George serve on our Board of Directors," said John Kremer, President and Board of Director of RPS. "His unmatched experience in the industry will benefit both PSC and RPS." RPS has been developing and implementing Engineering Controls and Custom Systems since 1978. With their roots stretching back to the development of the Naval nuclear programs of the 1950's, they continuing to develop sophisticated techniques and engineering solutions to confine, contain and control hazardous contaminants and minimize the risk of ionizing radiation and other industrial hazards. RPS provides quality products and services to nuclear power plants nationwide. 
For more information on Pajarito Scientific Corporation please go to www.pajaritoscientific.com . 
For more information on Radiation Protection Systems please go to www.radprosys.com .
